arts.ttl: Mattia Zaccagni’s Sublime Winner in Monza Extends Lazio’s Purple Patch
arts.sum: Lazio registered their tenth victory in their 11 fixtures in all competitions after edging past their hosts Monza thanks to Mattia Zaccagni’s solitary strike. arts.ttl: Serie A | Monza 0-1 Lazio: Match Report
arts.sum: Mattia Zaccagni delivered a stunning performance, scoring the decisive goal that secured Lazio a 1-0 victory against Monza in their latest Serie A clash. This win marks a continuation of Lazio’s impressive form both domestically and in European competitions. The Aquile entered the match with high spirits, having triumphed in nine of their last ten encounters, including a thrilling last-minute victory over FC Porto that placed them at the top of their Europa League group. Despite the absence of Gaetano Castrovilli due to injury, Nuno Tavares returned from suspension to bolster the squad. arts.ttl: Serie A | Monza v Lazio: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: As Lazio prepare to face Monza in their upcoming Serie A clash, manager Marco Baroni finds himself with a wealth of options at his disposal. The recent return of Manuel Lazzari from injury and the availability of Tijjani Noslin after serving a UEFA suspension have bolstered the squad, giving Baroni the luxury of rotation amidst a demanding schedule. While Gaetano Castrovilli remains sidelined until 2025, the rest of the squad appears to be in good health. This favorable situation allows Baroni to consider tactical adjustments and personnel changes as Lazio continues to compete on both domestic and European fronts. arts.ttl: Lazio dreaming big as they go to Monza
arts.sum: After the first 11 matches of Serie A in 2024, Monza were fifth with 20 points, earned from six wins and two draws (3L), behind only Inter, Milan, Roma, and Bologna. Monza have never won any of their nine Serie A encounters with the two Roman clubs, with a record of four draws, including the two most recent at U-Power Stadium, and five defeats.
